The host was awesome. So kind, friendly & helpful. I was coming from the Bay Area & they recommended sights I should see along the way.
He puts in effort to make the guests feel welcomed. The refrigerator even had water & sodas in it, which I think is soooo thoughtful!
I would recommend this place to anyone & would 100% stay again!

Stayed one night
review_text: We needed a place at the last minute and Richard‘s place fit the bill. It was close to where we were going to get dropped off at and it was close to where we needed to go. Richard was very friendly, communicative, and understanding of our situation. Richard went above and beyond with trying to help us out with our situation when we had an issue with our truck. We could not have asked for a more helpful, respectful, considerate host. It helps when your down to believe in human kind again. The space was clean, spacious and exactly what we needed to relax for the night before tackling our issue in the morning. Morning was Easter Sunday and more difficult to figure out our way…Richard was there to assist. We eventually got the help we needed and was just grateful to have this little airbnb to relax in. Coffee was good, everything worked out just fine. Kudos to the hosts.

Thank you for a wonderful stay!

,

January 2024
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The most valuable aspect of staying with Richard was that he was a wonderful travel host from the very beginning. He asked me where I was traveling from and made some great recommendations for things to do along the way. Watching the videos he sent would have been very helpful, but unfortunately, I missed it while I was driving which had some helpful directions. Since I arrived after dark, reviewing the directions closely was crucial to avoid any confusion. However, Richard was very responsive and called me to ensure I found the location. The apartment had a well-stocked coffee bar, a good-sized fridge with a separate freezer, a hot water kettle, and a microwave. My 9-year-old son and I had a comfortable night's sleep andeverything we needed to recharge before getting back on the road again. I would stay here again if I'm ever in the area.

I also want to mention this was probably the cleanest Airbnb I’ve ever been in. Everything was pristine, and I felt right at home. I also love the idea of a journal for guests as I read through and got some more ideas while travelling down the coast! The whole Sea-cation experience was wonderful and I also loved the decor! I would absolutely stay here again in a heartbeat. Thank you Rich and Cathy!

review_text: We had an absolutely amazing handful of days in Brookings, in large part to our wonderful accommodations. The suite was exactly as is pictured, and is in a wonderful, safe little neighborhood. We were able to ride in on our motorcycle without any issues, and we were able to walk to restaurants and the harbor, and anything else we wanted to do very easily. We had one minor issue with a coffee pot that went bad, and Richard very quickly brought over another one. His hospitality is unmatched. We truly appreciate how he went above and beyond to ensure we enjoyed our time on the coast. Living in Southern Oregon, my entire life, I’ve spent a lot of time on our coast, and going forward, we will use Richard’s “Seacation” as our main place to stay. Thank you again for such a wonderful time. We will see you next time.

Place was comfy, warm, nice TV, coffee maker, and he even stocks the mini fridge with some nice sodas/flavored waters. Would definitely stay again. Oh, and get the pizza at Fat Cat Pizza that is just nearby—super delicious pizza. Area around is fairly quiet and peaceful, plenty of food nearby, and you are on the beautiful Oregon Coast, what's more to say.

This is for sure one of the best AirBnbs I have stayed at. There is a Keurig and mini-fridge freezer combo as well as a microwave. The space is small but homey and separated from their main home. I couldn't have asked for better hosts! I will be staying another week in this Airbnb but couldn't wait to leave my initial review. Dont miss out on this one!
Also Richard has carefully curated the easiest instructions for finding the place I have ever used! He will reach out and make sure you find your way easily and check in is beyond easy!

Déjà Vu is a beautiful A-frame in a serene coastal setting, close to Brookings and many trails and viewpoints along the Boardman Scenic Corridor. It was the perfect home base for a weekend on the coast.
Eliza was welcoming and responsive, and the cabin was clean with a well-equipped kitchen. The deck overlooking forest and ocean, clawfoot tub, and sauna were among the highlights. We hope to return again soon!

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We loved the cabin from the moment we walked in. It was immaculately clean, tidy and organized. The house is so creative and with all the windows you feel as if you are outside. You can open the house up and hear all the birds singing their beautiful songs. The beds are comfortable with very nice bedding and plenty of space to put your personal items. The views from both upstairs and downstairs are spectacular. It’s close enough to Brookings to make it convenient but far enough out of town to feel remote. There are neighbors around the cabin, but we never saw or heard them. You feel like you are alone on top of the hill. The sauna and the bath tub are perfect after a day of hiking. Soaking in the tub with the view is incredible. We only wished we stayed longer than four nights. We love this place and can’t wait to go back.

They are very knowledgeable of the area and directed us to beautiful locations and beaches nearby. I felt right at home with the plants, the art, the large deck, sauna, the yoga mats...it is just such a peaceful retreat to cleanse the mind. If you are in a much needed getaway, this is absolutely perfect!

The retro decoration was so cool !

review_text:
We were definitely expecting a more secluded stay, but between the neighbors’s dog barking night & day, and being able to clearly hear the other neighbors conversation next door while sitting on the deck, we felt the whole point of “getting away from it all” was a bit lost.
The main bathroom is in desperate need of updating. We began to dread using the shower (the shower-head was ancient and coated in plaque, while the shower itself was cracked and stained) and avoided using the downstairs toilet because it would make odd noises for several minutes.
For the good: the sauna was great, and the clawfoot tub with its view saved the trip for us. And the proximity to hiking trails and the distance between Brookings and Gold Beach was ideal.
Of note: the bedrooms had no curtains which meant the sun didn’t let us sleep past 6 am.

Erin is a wonderful host who made sure my stay was very comfortable and relaxing.
She has created a beautiful space that has all the period pieces from my own Nana's house, including an old fashioned (very functional) oven/stove and a long, deep clawfoot tub.
Great location, close to my favorite beaches and coastal hikes.
I am in Brookings every month to visit my son and his new family, so I am a Nana now too.
This sweet spot will be my home away from home for future visits as it meets all my needs and then some!
Thank you Erin for providing such a lovely homey environment.

name: Dorise
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

December 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
A great place right on the cliff above Chetco Cove with fabulously large windows that allow gazing in 180 degree direction and in view of lovely sunrises and sunsets at this time of year. Sitting outside on the deck would be great when it’s warm, dry, and sunny.
The house is furnished in a contemporary style with all amenities you could need and want, within walking distance to Chetco Point, Fred Meyer store, restaurants, bars, the jetty, etc, and in a very quiet neighborhood.
The 6 of us had plenty of room to spread out and play games, chat, or retreat to a quiet corner.
It’s very bright in the daytime but lacks sufficient lighting in the living room, making it hard to use the huge sectional couch for reading or games for these non-TV users. We ended up all sitting under one lamp on the floor while the large couch was unused.
Thank you, Holly, for sharing your great home with us. We hope to be back!

review_text:
We got married in the Northern California Redwoods in October 2023 and stayed 4 nights at 309 Memory Lane and we can’t wait to go back!! Everything is as advertised and exactly how all the previous guests have described it, every last detail is thought of with this home and that’s exactly how we felt while we were there….that were at home. It’s breathtaking views, comfortable beds, luxurious toiletries, incredible showers, that master bathroom tub is a must-do, and even all the fixtures throughout the house. We wanted to move in and never leave. The design and decor are awesome and amazing and we would love to know who came up with this masterpiece. Holly was great as well; we had a couple of questions and she got right back to us. The check-in process was easy and the interactions dealing with everything were completely seamless.
We couldn’t have asked for a better experience and we certainly plan on coming back for one of our future anniversaries!

We had a family gathering including multiple families from out of state. We just wanted a place to be together, near a beach with room for everyone. Not only did this beautiful home fit the bill perfectly, the views alone exceeded everyone's expectations.
The highlights for us was the gigantic couch that everyone could sit on at the same time, the open space for kids to play, and a dinner table all 8 adults could fit at comfortably. It also didn't hurt to have three full bathrooms.

name: Emily
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
The home is gorgeous- the finishes were exquisite, there is so much space with quality appliances and amenities. It felt very comfortable and clean.
The location is close to a small rocky beach below. The view is amazing: bird watching and seals, along with watching the fishermen along the jetty. Lots of extras in the home- well stocked kitchen. Beautiful deck with gas fire pit.
Things to consider: the kids room is more like a closet w/windows with no blinds or drapes. The cots (not beds, smaller than a twin) aren’t suitable for anyone over the age of 12. The beds in the other spacious rooms should be upgraded to kings- they seem like very small queen beds. The silverware is gold plated and can’t go in the dishwasher, front light (and camera) flash on all night leading to light in the downstairs bedroom. The art is different: naked paintings, photo of boy peeing (his head only but ugh), kids room had photo of girls in bikinis.
Quiet gorgeous stay in a beautiful spacious home.

You can't get directly down to the beach in front of the house, but there are many great beaches very nearby. We particularly enjoyed Whaleshead Beach, about 10 minutes north of town.

The home is spacious; beautifully designed and decorated; outfitted with plethora thoughtful amenities that put the icing on the cake; and, well, THE VIEW. Over four days of our stay we kept wondering whether we'd start take it for granted - sitting on the deck in the morning, drinking coffee and watching the ospreys and herons hunting for their breakfast; relaxing on the extremely cozy sofas; cooking meals in the awesome kitchen - but, no, every day was special and at the end of it we left reluctantly, and hoping to come back again soon.

The space is so cozy, comfortable and relaxing. We slept wonderfully on the bed, found the kitchenette to be beyond sufficiently stocked, and enjoyed all the warm and inviting details like fresh eggs from Willow’s backyard hens, mini faux fireplace heater, fuzzy robes and slippers & complimentary bottle of wine. We also loved that it was walking distance to Azalea park, and half a mile to most of Brookings best eateries, etc. For the price, this Airbnb far exceeded our expectations. We highly recommend to anyone staying in the Brookings area!

We had a late check in (8.30 pm after a long drive down PCH) and Willow was accommodating of it. On request she allowed us to park our vehicle inside of her property which gave us a large vote of confidence in the trust she had in us.
On entering the studio, essential oil filled the space and we felt welcome to stay at our new home for the night. The surroundings were quiet and for breakfast we enjoyed a complimentary strawberry-rhubarb cake and freshly laid eggs.
For anyone passing my Brookings we would highly recommend this place and Willow makes the experience wonderful

The bed and pull-out sofa are super comfy - top-of-the-line linens and heavy comforters (the pull-out even has a comfortable mattress topper). The kitchen is well stocked with everything you need from the essential kitchen gadgets to an air fryer, coffee/tea set up, snacks to munch on and breakfast items for the next morning (including fresh eggs from their chickens)! The extra nice touches included a homemade strawberry rhubarb breakfast cake, fresh eggs, fresh flowers, a sound machine, comfy bed linens -- I could go on and on! It's a great stop if you are visiting the Redwoods or the Oregon coast. Can't wait to stay again.

Everything from the welcome note to ALL of the thoughtful touches inside were amazing. Willow clearly puts a lot of effort into welcoming guests and if you stay here, you will certainly understand. I was here only for one night but loved the location, ease of checking in and just how nice it was to stay in a place that had every detail taken care of between two long days on the road. I can’t wait to come back!
Book this, you will not regret it :)

Such a convenient location for hiking by the scenic corridor! Willow was so sweet greeting us upon arrival and departure! Honestly a perfect experience and we cannot wait to go back! Thanks Willow!

name: Wyatt
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay at Willow's apartment was lovely, and we highly recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, airy, relaxing play to stay in Brookings. Perfect apartment for a couple, although there was a sofa bed if you have a larger group in mind.
One of the things we appreciated was that it felt like a very health conscious environment, without lots of heavily scented cleaning products, bath products, or air fresheners, which my wife and I really appreciate. We had a unpleasant experience at another Airbnb where the fragrance of the fabric softeners used on the bedsheets got on our clothing, luggage, and everything and the smell followed us for a week. Nothing like that at Willow's, which really allowed us to focus on other things. We enjoyed the essential oil diffuser for a light natural smell, although the fresh air from the ocean was really the best. We also enjoyed the healthy banana bread! There were also fresh eggs from her chickens available, but unfortunately we didn't have time to make them.
The apartment was so clean and new feeling that we almost felt like the first people to stay there, and we did our best to keep it that way. There was nothing we needed that wasn't readily available, and the attention to detail was really above and beyond.
We would definitely stay here again! Part of our plans had to be changed because some road maintenance was being done in Jedediah Redwood State Park, so it's likely that we will return at some point. Again, highly recommended!

review_text: We only stayed one night on the way up the coast on our roadtrip. Everything about the rental was as advertised. Incredible snack basket and beverages were there for our enjoyment,at no extra cost. Check in was easy and checkout had no To Do lists. This rental is private on a beautiful property. You can walk easily over to the side of the Main house on the property and get an amazing view of the ocean and beach below. There is a great parking spot,with easy load in, a very private patio with a BBQ,and patio chairs and table. The kitchen in this rental is well thought out,with everything one needs to prepare food. There is a full size fridge (YAY), and even a stacking washer dryer for longer stays. Internet was fast. I am short, so the bed was a bit tall for me, but once I climbed in (LOL) it was so comfortable.~ We will return for a longer stay next time. Thanks again.~ Karen and Drew

review_text:
We spent 2 nights at the Sea Ranch, celebrating our 30 year anniversary. We were greeted with fresh flowers and a bottle of champagne chilling in the fridge, they also supplied snacks as well as stuff to make spaghetti. The place was spotless, private, very safe, and super cozy. All toiletries were provided and the kitchen was fully set up for preparing meals.
Gary and Misty introduced themselves and then gave us our privacy-all the while making themselves fully available should we need anything.
Sea Ranch was definitely a perfect location for home base, being near the Redwoods, the ocean, and town.
My only negative is that as far as an ocean view goes, it really didn't have one from inside the unit (just a bit from the kitchen) because the main house blocks it. In order to get a good view we had to use the main home's deck, which for us felt uncomfortable, like we were invading their space, but that's just us.
Aside from the lack of ocean views, everything else was amazing!

I would stay there again in a heartbeat, and hope to do so in the future.

We walked to dinner but might not be “walkable” for all people.
I did not pay attention to all the amenities but certainly was grateful for the washer and dryer when I had a loosing battle with some chocolate!
This place deserves my highest praise and we will go back for certain!

We stayed 4 nights so it was really helpful to have a full kitchen and laundry machines. The property was spectacular - a definite highlight of our trip was enjoying the beautiful sunset view over the ocean while having a glass of wine at the picnic table. We used this location as a jumping off point for exploring the Redwoods (both the National park and state parks), and it worked out very well. We would absolutely stay here again!

review_text: In a word: welcoming. Misty and Gary's place is a gorgeous, comfortable space with an unbeatable overlook of the Chetco cove shoreline thanks to access to the lower level of their private deck, behind the main house and only a few seconds walk away from the Airbnb. The unit itself has high quality amenities and many thoughtful touches that will make you feel right at home. Have you ever driven around a beach town, looked up at the fanciest houses overlooking the sea, and wondered what it would be like to be in one of them, watching the sunset? Here's your chance.

name: Mary
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Pulling onto the parking pad, I caught a glimpse of the Pacific. It was a lovely, sunny day, making our arrival perfect. Our hosts, Misty, and Gary, came outside to greet us warmly.
The guest house and patio were spotlessly clean and perfectly maintained. I must be honest; the Air B&B photos don't do justice to this lovely getaway bungalow.
We both love to cook. We found everything we needed (except the food, of course) to cook three vacation breakfasts, two take-along lunches, and two spectacular dinners. The well-equipped kitchen was divine.
The bed, or should I say the cloud of comfort, was exceptional, as were the linens. Plenty of pillows and a cozy comforter made it a place where we wanted to linger.
The property is beautifully landscaped, attracting birds of several species. My companion and I began to watch for a young female Raven that we saw each morning. She hopped around in the green lawn, looking for breakfast. She was comical.
While sipping our bubbly on the patio each evening, numerous hummingbirds came to a flowering tree no more than 5-feet from us. They buzzed and darted for a bit, then would land on a branch for a rest. It was magical.
One evening we went to the ocean-front picnic tables at the main house to watch whales feeding and playing in the shallow bay in front of the property—what a treat. At the same time, the Coast Guard was doing maneuvers. What a sunset!
We tried several restaurants in the area. There is a guide on the fridge we found particularly helpful. There is also a notebook with loads of suggestions for hiking and big tree-hugging. If you are into fishing, this seems to be a popular place for the sport.
Sea Ranch Guest House is one of the nicest Air B&Bs you will find in the area. The friendly and helpful hosts are on-property.
I highly recommend this lovely bungalow.

They have everything you could possibly need - travel bags (tooth paste, floss, shaving cream etc), cooking utensils (pots, pans, silverware) and clean towels/sheets. The bed was so comfortable and my partner and I fell asleep to the sound of the ocean crashing outside. The view of the Pacific is one of the best in Oregon and the property is beautifully maintained. Thank you Patrick for your kindness and positivity! It was infectious after a long day of driving! I can't wait to come back. 10/10 - 5 stars. STAY HERE!

review_text:
Gorgeous location! There are two decks off the main house that overlook the ocean which are available for guests to use anytime. Blankets and cushions for the deck chairs make for comfortable sunset viewing. From the deck there are stairs to the beach under the cliff but the bottom half of the stairs are closed (beach access is a few minutes down Hwy 101).
Barbara and Patrick were wonderful hosts and responded quickly to any correspondence. Patrick gave us a tour of the property and suite and was friendly, welcoming and professional. Check-in was easy and instructions provided for both parking and the suite. Lots of great information provided on local amenities and touristy things to do. Beautiful gardens and the fountain in front of the suite provided a gentle "white noise" when we had the windows open. Suite stocked with many useful items in case you forgot anything ("Crayola bandaids ba-ha-ha). We had a wonderful stay and highly recommend!

review_text: We can't say enough good things about our stay at Patrick and Barbara's B&B! They were so friendly and helpful, and there were so many extra little touches. The granola, juice, cheese, snacks, coffee...not to mention the sparkling cider they left for our anniversary. The mini fridge freezer is also big enough for a bag of ice. The bed was comfortable, the shower was great, and we had everything we needed, including extra toiletries, beach chairs, umbrellas (which we thankfully didn't need), a tray for dirty shoes near the front door, and plenty of privacy. The ocean views are incredible, the flowers around the property are gorgeous, and the location is perfect for a quick drive to grab something to eat, shop, run to the grocery store, etc. We took their advice and ordered the Golden Cashew Chicken at Kuhn Thai. Yum! We spent three nights, which wasn't enough, and would definitely stay there again!

Overall, I would highly recommended this place!! I will definitely be returning to this incredible Airbnb in the future.

The gated property adds an extra feeling of safety and the scenery is just incredible! Patrick took extra time upon our arrival to make sure that we knew how to access everything we could possibly need as well as providing wonderful local recommendations for dining and fun. Barbara shared beautiful ideas about hiking for us and local attractions to see in the area. She thought of every detail that would make our stay comfortable and restful. I have stayed at many Airbnb locations and have never had any hosts provide this many additional touches to make me feel at home. From bathrobes and slippers, to pantry essentials, toiletries, games and so much more, there was nothing I needed to stress over. This was such a relaxing and rejuvenating retreat for us and we will be back as often as we can. We are Barbara and Patrick customers for life!
Thank you so much for having us!

This stay was the highlight of our whole coast trip! The space was clean and comfortable, and stocked with everything someone might need, from snacks, to extra toiletries, to a bookshelf full of books. Barbara and Patrick really thought of everything, and they even put together binders with information about local places to eat and activities to do. They were so kind and welcoming, and their thoughtfulness made us feel right at home.
The view of the beach from the deck was unbelievable. We watched the sunset from there both nights of our stay, and I couldn't imagine a better spot to be. That being said, we were also only a few minutes away from a really great public beach, as well as the rest of the town, so we were never short on things to do or places to go.
I can't recommend Barbara and Patrick's place enough, and I know if I'm ever back in the area this will be the first place I want to stay.

But the part that impressed us the most was how many “above and beyond” thoughtful and generous items were supplied that made our trip so great! Coffee, teas, honey, sugar, snacks, fruit, cheese, bagels, bread, butter... hygiene items, beach towels and chairs, umbrellas... truly just sooo much more than any air BNB we have ever stayed at!! We would love to return again and again to stay here and we highly recommend you do as well!!

Don't pass up hiking the Boy Scout Tree Trail in the Jedidiah Smith State Park in Crescent City, and also visit Secret Beach north of Brookings.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
WOW! Best AirBnB ever!!! My fiance and I stayed here for two nights and we had an amazing time.
Home: Very cozy. The bed's comforter and pillows were extremely comfy. The bathroom (specifically the shower and toilet) were all really clean. Toiletries were available. The kitchenette was small but adequate for us. We only used the fridge and toaster to eat the bagels they provided. There were also plenty of breakfast foods and snacks provided. We couldn't hear the voices or sounds of the other renters on the other side of us, but we did hear things like doors opening. No big deal. It's more than enough space for two people (a couple, ideally), but might feel a little snug with 3 or more people.
Balcony/Beach: Exactly what you see in pictures. Maybe even better. I know it's all over this listing but it bears repeating: PRIVATE BEACH ACCESS! It is admittedly not the most accessible though- it takes a lot of stairs and some are very steep. The railings also seem easy to get splinters on. I would be cautious of young children and people with any mobility issues using these stairs.
Hosts: Patrick met with us when we first arrived and showed us around. We ran into him a handful of times (mostly because we actually stayed around the home for like... most of the trip lol. rare on a vacation for us personally, but the private beach was better than any of the public ones!) and had some friendly chats. Super welcoming and kind!

There is a nice Fred Meyer store a few minutes away where you can pick up groceries, clothing, or anything else you might need.
There are so many things to do and see nearby. Stout Grove was our favorite. We also stopped at a bunch of the scenic points that are along the 101 as you drive north towards Gold Beach. We stopped at Kissing Rock just before Gold Beach and had fun rock-hounding on the beach.

review_text: The cabin is tucked away in a private, peaceful spot on the property facing the morning sun, which we found to be a nice way to wake-up each morning. The sunlight came in through a pretty wood line, so it wasn’t too harsh. At night, stars were beautifully visible, and Mrs. Linda was very gracious to turn on lanterns for our use to walk to the cabin with each night. She stocked the cabin with bottled water, snack bars, and some fresh fruits prior to our visit. She really goes the extra mile for her guests. The cabin is only a few minutes drive from the Samuel Boardman Scenic Corridor with various (gorgeous) hikes/viewpoints, which we thought was a huge plus. It’s also a short 10-15 min drive to town if you want to enjoy shopping or the harbor areas of town.

review_text:
My husband & I stayed here for our elopement in the Redwoods. It was important to us to find a place with a cabin feel & the ambiance of being within the trees. This was definitely it!
Linda’s place is even more stunning in person. The cabin is beautiful with all the modern amenities. The decor is wonderful. Our favorite part was waking up to the sunrising through the trees & enjoying a cup of tea on the deck.
Every detail is tended to from a great coffee selection, bottled waters & we even had a bowl of fresh fruit. This cabin has everything you need for a romantic getaway.
We had the opportunity to meet Linda & she was absolutely lovely. We thanked her for the wonderful accommodations & allowing us to do our wedding pictures at the cabin. We can’t wait to share them with her!
It was sad leaving after our 5 day stay, however look forward to returning next year to celebrate our 1 year anniversary & make more amazing memories!
Thank you again Linda 🤍

Boardman corridor which is literally on the doorstep of the cabin. It was some of the most beautiful scenery we have ever seen. We picked up takeaway from pacific sushi and grill and sprezzatura, and went to breakfast at blue water cafe and lounge, all of which were fantastic, we just wish we could have tried more places. Linda was an incredible host and and just made our stay perfect. We couldn’t recommend this place enough and just wish we could have stayed longer.

Linda was very gracious at being flexible with the check-in time, as we planned to make the drive quicker than expected. We are very picky about mattresses and this bed (and bedding!) was just so comfortable. The location of this cabin, the stunning view, cleanliness, cozy and homey atmosphere, and so much more are things I would give more than 5 stars on. Perfect “off-grid” feeling with all of the simple luxuries, it was exactly the retreat we needed for our anniversary vacation. This is a place that made us feel tucked away in the woods and right at home as soon as we walked in. Huge thanks to Linda for hosting such a lovely home and experience.

review_text: There are not enough words to describe how incredibly beautiful this space was! It is so nicely done down to the smallest details. Set back from the larger main house, the cabin has a very private, cozy and even romantic feel to it. When you first walk up it seems somewhat nondescript, as it is just the back of the cabin showing from the outside, but as you walk down to the wrap around porch you realize this place is an absolute gem. The main windows and sitting porch are elevated into the woods, raised up on pillars, giving you the most gorgeous wooded view. The space is decorated so beautifully, and has a classy, clean, tastefully designed elevated cabin feel. The walk in stone shower was gorgeous and the kitchenette had everything we needed. Thank you for such a wonderful stay!!

review_text:
When I texted Luke about difficulties finding the remote to control the heat on this very cold night, Luke responded quickly to let me know that it’s kept on the wall near the kitchen and opposite the bed. And when I had a problem locking the door when going out to dinner, he again replied quickly that I should enter the code and turn the deadbolt to the left while pulling the door handle towards me.
A short sheet of instructions might save him from responding to texts like like mine.

name: Kathryn
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: We had a great stay. It was dark when we arrived but the front porch light was on. The inside was cold and dark. The lights were easy to find but it was hard to figure out the heater. We finally found the remote to turn on the heater but there were no directions on how to use it. We messaged Luke and he was quick to respond. We tried the back and forth messages because we were only getting cold air in the winter. He offered to come over to help when we finally said yes please. He was right over and when at first we couldn’t figure out the heat he offered to bring over another heat source. He was finally able to figure out how the wall heater worked and with in a little it was nice and toasty. We had a great night sleep and my husband said the bed was the most comfortable he had ever slept in. We took the advice in the book of places to see the next day and loved it. Thanks for all your help. We would stay here again the next time we are in Brookings. Luke is a great host.

name: Jessica
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
December 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We enjoyed our stay at the Little Green Door. Luke was very kind, helpful, and responded quickly in our communication. The studio was warm and cozy, and supplies were provided for our needs. I could have used a little more counter space for food preparation. We liked the heater, and at night we prefer to sleep cooler. We appreciated the extra blanket Luke brought us when we needed one. We had a nice visit.
The highlight of our stay was seeing gray whales as they migrated south. We watched them for two hours at the upper Harris Beach parking lot. At Luke's suggestion, we then explored Indian Sands. He was right, it was steep getting there! And it was well worth it. We spent another two hours on that adventure. The crashing waves were a perfect ending to our journey.
All in all, a positive experience.

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Luke’s place is an entire 1 bed 1 bath house located centrally in Brookings, very close to the 101 highway! I stayed there for 2 nights exploring the southern Oregon coast! The location is very close to Samuel Boardman scenic corridor and comes with a fully equipped kitchen, washer dryer and all the amenities for long term stay! The house is spotless, has a nice sized living room area with TV. I had some issues with check in but got resolved pretty quickly. Luke was responsive and provided plenty of resources for things to do in the area, places to eat etc. The area is super quiet and I’d highly recommend it for anyone looking for a much needed space to crash during vacation but also relax and laze around in southern Oregon! I’d definitely be back soon.

Oh. And has an a/c fancy unit. This would be a great unit for someone working remotely that needed a place for an extended stay. Or just a weekend getaway. What a great host. We will definitely be back! Thank you, sir.

Stayed one night
review_text:
For our short one night stay in Brookings, my husband and I had a very comfortable stay. Not only were we impressed by how the space was used, but having wifi, a full-sized refrigerator/freezer, a microwave, a coffee maker with good tasting ground coffee with filters, and a bedroom fan were all helpful to us. For kayaking, we called the number on the Riverside Market flyer who gave us great advice on where to kayak that day since the water was low.
For a longer stay, I would have definitely used the washer/dryer, the stove/oven, cooking utensils, pots/pans, and prep bowls. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
August 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our Google Map led us incorrectly to a street corner when we put in Luke’s address, so that combined with Luke being hard to reach, and not as communicative, made for a nerve-wracking check-in. I have communicated with Airbnb and Luke that more information about his place’s location and more responsive communication would’ve resolved this issue, as we were out-of-state visitors and had never been to the Oregonian coast. Luke apologized kindly and did become more responsive after check-in, which we appreciated.
After we located his place, we had a comfortable stay. It is spacious (minus the bathroom, small sink and small area), and had many great amenities, including a washer and dryer. The Oregonian coast is beautiful so we will definitely make a return trip!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2021
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Nice place, very comfortable. Having laundry facilities (with supplied detergent) was GREAT for what was the half way point of our trip. Location is decent, in a residential area near a park and walkable to the main business district of Brookings. Bed was great, maybe the most comfortable we slept in during our vacation (we stayed at 7 different places).
Only one complaint, the bathroom wasn't great. It was mostly ok, but the sink was comically small. Like it was so small it was hard to brush your teeth or wash your face small. I've never seen a sink that small. Otherwise this place was a very comfortable, clean place to spend a night and I would return if in the area.

name: Joseph
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2021
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Excellent stay! Truly the best on the coast. Brookings is a beautiful little city with all the amenities of a larger one (movie theater, bars, coffee shops) but with a small population and large amount of natural beauty. This apartment was well equipped for my girlfriend and I to live in for 5 weeks, working remotely from laptops. The WiFi was strong throughout the apartment, allowing one to work from the solid wood desk while the other worked from the bar. Air conditioner was strong everywhere, and all appliances were new. The bedroom closet has all the beach amenities needed, like towels, buckets, kites. The tv works great, and was hooked up to all streaming platforms. The backyard had comfortable chairs and lights for lounging. There was ample private parking space, enough for multiple vehicles. The location is also perfect! It’s a 2 minute bike ride to the main strip of Brookings, and about 8 minutes to the quays or Chetco point. The host was very responsive and present for any requests we had, which were seldom due to the perfect place we arrived to. It was a great value for the money, and I’m surprised I was able to book for a month. My only regret is that I didn’t nab it for the rest of the remote-working summer. My goal is now to find a house or apartment in Brookings
